name: De Waterzooi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the 2nd time and it was as lovely as the first. We visited Belgium with some friends and since it was our friends first time in Europe we thought we would start them off at this B&B and they certainly were not dissapointed. This is by far one of the finest B&B's around and you cannot go wrong staying here as Kay and Christian are wonderful people and perfect hosts. You will always remember your stay at this amazing home.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice suite, large, in the center of the town facing "Het Gravensteen". Friendly hosts, good breakfast. There will be always better but it will be hard to find.
reviews.title: Top

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at De Waterzooi on April 2nd and 3rd, having arrived by train & Eurostar via Brussels. The city itself is beautiful but much less of a tourist trap than Bruges. De Waterzooi is central, with the number 1 tram stop outside. It is a short walk to everything of interest, not least the vibrant Graslei where there are bars, restaurants and great views to keep anyone exceedingly happy! We stayed in the Felix suite. It is spacious, light and everything about it is even more 'home from home' than Kay hopes it will be! All the things you would expect are there and more. Not least from one window you will have a perfect view of the castle, Gravensteen, and from the bedroom terrace you see the city towers and over towards the 16th Century guildhouses along the Leie. The breakfasts set us up for the day and Kay introduced additional surprise courses to ensure we weren't peckish till dinner! We had one of those at the Graslei brasserie (very good) and another at the more upmarket Pakhuis, which was well worth the extra money. Both were spot on recommendations from Kay, who along with Christian, could not have done more to welcome us into their superbly renovated 18th Century home.
reviews.title: A wonderful B&B in a perfect location,superb city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kay and Christian are wonderful hosts who have lovingly restored and converted de Waterzooi into the most exquisite accommodation.
reviews.title: Surely the best ever B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tram 1 takes you straight from Gent St Pieters station and drops you in St Veerleplein, just steps from de Waterzooi. Kay gave us the most generous welcome and, over a cup of tea (along with petit fours and chocolates!), gave us a fascinating insight into Gent, the history of de Waterzooi and very helpful information on local restaurants.
reviews.title: Views to die for

reviews.text: We stayed for 7 nights...Lucky us!! Found De Waterzooi on theTripadvisor site, and even before we arrived, Christian was helping is with every detail you could imagine, via e-mail. On arrival, we were greeted warmly by Kay and Christian, had a sit-down ( in the gorgeous breakfast room) with a cool drink and cookies, an overview of services, and then a room tour to describe all amenities.Our group had the whole house for a conference in Ghent, and we were all overwhelmed at the lovely suites, so roomy and comfortable, and beautifully decorated in neutrals, with large decks outside.....a castle view right from the window. Front windows look on to busy interesting square and castle, bedrooms are at the back, and look on to quiet courtyard., even room-darkening curtains. Perfect for sleeping.The house has magnetic swipe cards for entry and rooms, a little elevator, A/C in bedroom, beautiful linens, memory foam beds, mini-fridge, and coffee making supplies, wineglasses. Such amazing bathrooms, with all amenities, hair dryer, magnifying mirror, hand held, and rain showers, fluffy towels and carpets. The location..very central. close to public transit, and walking distance to shopping, etc..Walking through cobblestone streets, over little bridges, and canals, with wonderful old churches and buildings, and fabulous restaurants.
reviews.title: Unforgettable experience, irreplaceable hosts
Without a doubt "The Best Ever" stay we have ever had!
reviews.text: And the breakfasts......such a lovely room filled with old wood furniture and a giant-sized table and huge floor to ceiling windows looking on to the courtyard...soft music.. beautiful table settings...we were talking about these breakfasts to anyone who would listen. Kay and Christian were attentive hosts, and seemed to be so glad to see us every morning, and were around to chat with us, and answer questions and give suggestions about the area. We will always remember these breakfasts...we didn't have to eat again until dinnertime! You never have this bounty at home in the mornings, but what a treat it was! Breads, croissants, eggs any style, cheeses and meats, fruit salads, homemade yoghurts, fresh squeezed orange juice, teas, and coffees, preserves. Kay added something special each day...French toast, quiche, fruit crisps. Amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was perhaps THE best B&B experience we have had.
reviews.title: Simply perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kay and Christian are wonderful hosts, This home is their passion, and it shows. I call Kay ' the Martha of Ghent'. As we were all preparing to leave, Kay came to the door with a tray with small packages of Belgian chocolate for each of us as a small 'bye-bye'. We left the next morning independently from the rest of the group very early in the morning. Kay left a lovely breakfast tray in our fridge, and even got up to give us a hug goodbye in the morning. I just arrived home and am jet-lagged and travel weary, but I did not want to forget a single detail to pass on. This is a truly magical place with warm and wonderful hosts. If you ever have the chance to stay here, do not pass it up.
reviews.title: The Waterzooi B&B is a gem and worth every penny

reviews.text: What can we add that hasn't been said before? We found Waterzooi B&B through TripAdvisor and after everything that has been said, we were looking forward to our stay here after a week in Bruges.
reviews.title: De Waterzooi was an amazing bed and...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights during Thanksgiving 2011. Checked in Sunday afternoon and out on Tuesday late-morning. This was part of a Ghent-Rouen-Paris trip.
reviews.title: Amazing owners; Castle across the street ... enough said!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our direct flight from Houston to Paris was delayed three hours; as a result, we missed our train from Paris to Ghent and had to reschedule to arrive in Ghent four hours later than we originally told the owners. This was not a problem for Christian and Kay (the owners of the B&B). We emailed them and they made sure to be at the B&B awaiting our late arrival.
reviews.title: It's all true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off: Christan and Kay have to be two of the sweetest people in the world. They purchased the property and completely renovated the back side of the property (on the canal) where they live. They then connected their private dwelling to the front three-story building that faces the downtown square and Gravensteen Castle (see pictures).
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!

reviews.text: We were very tired from the overnight flight and multiple train trips. Christian and Kay sat us down in the communal kitchen and poured us hot tea and a cold beer. Kay talked to us about the history of Ghent and provided us with a map of the city. She then learned a little about us and tried to figure out the sort of things we like to do while on European vacations. She made excellent recommendations that would fit into our short schedule. Meanwhile, Christian delivered our bags to our room (we stayed in the FELIX room).
reviews.title: A little gem in the heart of Ghent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was amazing and has front and back windows (included a rear balcony that allows you a view of all four “spires” in the city … see pics). Right outside our front was the downtown square and view of the Castle (as well as an easily accessed tram stop).
reviews.title: A wonderful few days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had promised the owners Christian and Kay we would put a review on immiedately upon our return but my wife hasn't, so I will!
reviews.title: A fantastic and unique boutique Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The De Waterzooi is a simply beautiful place to stay. From the moment the hosts meet you, everything becomes relaxing and stress free. The accommodation is superb, the best I have ever come across and the charge per night for the rooms is worth every penny.
reviews.title: A little piece of sanctuary in a hectic world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite 5 months passing since we stayed there, the view over looking the Castle at night was simply stunning and memorable.
reviews.title: The best place to stay ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast served in the morning was more than we could eat and everything is home cooked and prepared by Kay. The efforts she went to prepare the food in her dining room was amazing and you really become a guest staying in their house, which is a converted church.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Superb!!
reviews.text: Ghent does not have the attractions of Bruges but is only a 20 min train journey away and having been to Bruges numerous times, it was a pleasant change to discover this city. Unfortunately, the town square had all its stones up, so walking in mud was a problem on occasions.

description: For those who want to discover the hart of medieval Ghent and stay in a luxurious top location. For them one perfect match: The Bed & Breakfast “De Waterzooi”! The Waterzooi is located at the feet of the medieval castle “Gravensteen” upon the little St Veerleplace, surrounded by charming terraces and restaurants, and next to the unique “Patershol”. Our recently renovated house (anno 1737), today it contents two suites. The luxury suites each are installed with: Separate living with plasma TV, mini bar, and bedroom with Tempur beds.
